intro: Ferreyranthus verbascifolius, commonly known as the woollyleaf ferreyranthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant is notable for its soft, silvery-gray foliage, which gives it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Ferreyranthus verbascifolius is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
